snippet: Roman Catholic officials in Harrisburg, Pa., say a policy seeks to prevent “substantial and potentially immodest” physical interaction.
abstract: Decision by Roman Catholic Diocese of Harrisburg, Pa, to require that boys on its school wrestling teams forfeit matches against female opponents comes at a time when girls are increasingly participating in traditionally male-dominated activities; new requirement leaves church at a crossroads between faith and gender inclusion.
lead_paragraph: Roman Catholic officials in Harrisburg, Pa., say a policy seeks to prevent “substantial and potentially immodest” physical interaction.

headline.main: With Ban on Wrestling Between Boys and Girls, Diocese Faces a Crossroads
headline.print_headline: With Ban on Wrestling Between Boys and Girls, Diocese Faces a Crossroads
